item.title: Urgent: Hazardous Fly-Tipping with Asbestos Behind Magdalen Hall, Purbrook Estate, 18th October
item.description:
Behind Magdalen Hall, in the Purbrook Estate car park, there is clear fly-tipping, including broken asbestos boards, a dead rat, and strong, unpleasant odours. These health and safety hazards have been left unattended for months, despite repeated complaints from the elderly resident living next to the site. Children play in this area daily, making the lack of action completely unacceptable. This situation demonstrates serious negligence, and immediate action is required. I have also contacted our local councillors regarding this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 164, Tower Bridge Road, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damaged kerb with useless temporary repair, 18th October
item.description:
This has been reported previously and a temporary repair completed. It had no effect and was damaged almost immediately. There is now a second kerb stone that is up in the air that will need repair but temporary repairs are a waste of resource so please do it properly. A stretch of bollards down here would stop the Lorrie’s from mounting the path and damaging the kerbs continually.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fraser Road, Northumberland Heath, Erith, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Severe ground subsidence and damage, 18th October
item.description:
Large 1-2 inch wide/1-2 foot long cracks are present in the pavement together with potholes and severely cracked paving stones. This is totally unacceptable on a pavement used especially by young children going to the nearby school and there will be an accident here soon.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheringham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Immediate Action Required – Asbestos & Waste at Purbrook Estate, 18th October
item.description:
I’m writing to raise a serious concern regarding the area behind Magdalen Hall on the Purbrook Estate, specifically in the car park near the fire exits. There is visibly broken asbestos board, a deceased pigeon, and fly-tipped waste that has remained there for several months. I understand this issue has been reported to the council multiple times. This area is frequented by young children, posing a clear health and safety risk. Additionally, an elderly resident living adjacent to the site has raised complaints about the persistent odour. I kindly request that this matter be addressed as a priority and the area cleared without further delay. I have also contacted Sunil Chopra, Sam Dalton, and Emily Hickson regarding this issue, as it reflects a concerning lapse in duty of care. Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Purbrook Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road surface causing damage to my property, 18th October
item.description:
Reported via mobile in the Damaged road category anonymously at 10:52, Wed 24 August 2022 Sent to London Borough of Bexley less than a minute later. FixMyStreet ref: 3776774. Cracks in the road and pavement vibrate our house every ten minutes. Cracks have appeared inside and outside the property this is due to cracks in the road clearly because when a Hgv (a bus every five-ten minutes ) passes by each way, our property shakes throughout. Made many complaints to the council but fail to hear nothing back, nor see any action, after 3 years of trying.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
